item.description:

item.title: Treevoutside 62 hook lane welling, 21st January
item.description:
Tree needs pruning. When leaves on branches nearly touching house. When windy branches will fall on cars in drive. The tree roots have already pushed my front wall over and this has been rebuilt. So if tree not trimmed back the branches sway in the wind causing tree trunk to sway which makes roots move under new wall. Needs pruning right back please. This tree is right outside 62 hook lane Da162dp. I don't think it has been cut back for a few years Many thanks Karen Bosworth

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Millman Street Community rooms, based at 50 Millman St. Entrance to estate between 38 & 34 Millman Street, 21st January
item.description:
Trees are located on the communal area of the flats, on the ground floor behind the lifts. Trees have not been checked for some time and need trimming back. Many branches are low and over hanger the day care centre and the children's nursery
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Doughty Mews, Holborn, Greater London

item.title: 4 lanes splits have potholes, 21st January

item.title: Decorative stones all over the pavement very slippery, 21st January
item.description:
Hi, I’ve just slipped over and hurt my back outside Morrisons petrol station in Erith James Watt Way. The decorative stones all around the plants at the petrol station entrance are all over the pavement. They’re very slippery. Slate flat pieces I.iPlease could you get them or someone to clean this up as soon as possible so it doesn’t happen to someone else.. I will see how it is tomorrow and may have to visit the hospital.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): James Watt Way, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree planted on bridge over Grade II* Nationally Listed asset, 21st January
item.description:
Southwark have three tree planted on or near the road over bridge of the Grade II* Nationally Listed asset. Their tree pits are open soil, and contributing to sustained surface water penetrating through into the valuable and historic 1865 built structure that holds up the road. Over time and over wet seasonal weather surface water ingress is adding to saturating the ground. This makes elimination of a possible mains water leak source much harder. Urgent action to remove trees, and assess if sub soil is also showing signs of a mains water leak.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
